title: Supreme Court Ruling on SNAP Benefits Leaves Families in Limbo
summary: In many states, it remained unclear how the Supreme Court’s Friday night order might immediately affect low-income residents.

title: How the Government Shutdown Is Affecting Air Travel
summary: Niraj Chokshi, our reporter covering transportation, describes where and how flights are being cut in the government shutdown.

title: A Timeline of the Legal Saga Surrounding SNAP Payments
summary: Weeks of uncertainty during the longest government shutdown in American history have left some states struggling to issue payments to food stamp recipients.

title: How Families Are Coping with SNAP Cuts During the Shutdown
summary: For the 42 million people who rely on the country’s largest anti-hunger program, it has been a chaotic, nerve-racking week. Here are some of their stories.

title: Worries Increase on Second Day of Flight Cancellations
summary: Disruptions to air travel on Saturday were modest, but officials and passengers were bracing for worse as the government shutdown continued.

title: A Light in Very Dark Days: Nancy Pelosi and AIDS
summary: As Ms. Pelosi announced her retirement, she was celebrated for her long tenure in Washington. But back home, she was remembered for showing up at a terrifying moment when others turned away.

title: Gavin Newsom, Eyeing 2028, Tries to Mess With Texas
summary: Celebrating his recent redistricting victory, the California governor swooped into a state led by a Republican rival and sent the latest signal about his presidential ambitions.

title: Live From New York: Zohran Mamdani’s Got Jokes
summary: New York City’s next mayor showed during the campaign that he has a sharp sense of humor. Keeping things light at City Hall could be trickier.

title: Inside Trump’s Deportation of Venezuelans: Four Months in a Salvadoran Prison
summary: The Times interviewed dozens of migrant men sent to a prison in El Salvador by the Trump administration. Independent forensic analysts called the testimony credible and consistent and said the treatment met the U.N.’s definition of torture.

title: Trump Was Never a Kingmaker. Are Republicans Finally Seeing It?
summary: The round table convenes to discuss what comes after the Democrats’ big wins — and whether the “red hat” coalition can recover.

title: Bruce Springsteen’s Father Complicates a Powerful American Narrative
summary: He had a good factory job that helped him raise a family. But it didn’t save him from despair.

title: The Astonishing Bull Market Will End One Day. Are You Ready?
summary: Big stock gains have always been followed by big losses. Here are tips on how to prepare.

title: Merck PCSK9 Pill Results Point to Extremely Low Cholesterol Future
summary: The drug targets the PCSK9 protein, and could give millions of people a more affordable option to reduce their heart disease risk.

title: John Cleary, Wounded in Kent State Shooting, Dies at 74
summary: He was shot in 1970 by the National Guard during a student protest over the Vietnam War that left four dead in Ohio. A photo of him lying on the ground and bleeding made the cover of Life magazine.

title: After More Than 30 Years, a Man Is Charged in Seattle Girl’s Killing
summary: Tanya Marie Frazier, 14, never returned from summer school in 1994, and was found dead in a wooded area five days later. The police say a new DNA analysis links a felon to her death.
